subject: Boston Marathon
Running
Tour de France (Bicycle Race)
Marathon Running
lead_paragraph: The seven-time Tour de France winner Lance Armstrong plans to run the Boston Marathon in April to raise money for his foundation. Armstrong, 36, qualified for Boston by completing the 2007 New York City Marathon in 2 hours 46 minutes 43 seconds, finishing in 214th place. The Boston qualifying time is 3:15 for men ages 35 to 39.In 1996, Armstrong had a diagnosis of testicular cancer that had spread to his lungs and brain. But he recovered to win the Tour from 1999 to 2005.The Lance Armstrong Foundation supports cancer research, prevention and better care for cancer survivors. Armstrong and others running for the foundation raised about $500,000 at last year’s New York City Marathon.
